com.tinkerpop.blueprints

Interface Index<T extends Element>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EventIndex, IdEdgeIndex, IdVertexIndex, Neo4jIndex, OrientIndex, TinkerGraph.TinkerKeyIndex

    public interface Index<T extends Element>
    An Index maintains a mapping between some key/value pair and an element. An index requires that the developer explicitly put elements of the graph into the index. The key/value pair need not be specific to the element properties. There is a query method to support index lookups beyond exact matches.
    Author:
    Marko A. Rodriguez (http://markorodriguez.com)

      • getIndexName

        String getIndexName()
        Get the name of the index.
        Returns:
        the name of the index

      • getIndexClass

        Class<T> getIndexClass()
        Get the class that this index is indexing.
        Returns:
        the class this index is indexing

      • put

        void put(String key,
       Object value,
       T element)
        Index an element by a key and a value.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to index the element by
        value - the value to index the element by
        element - the element to index

      • get

        CloseableIterable<T> get(String key,
                       Object value)
        Get all elements that are indexed by the provided key/value.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the indexed elements
        value - the value of the indexed elements
        Returns:
        an iterable of elements that have a particular key/value in the index

      • query

        CloseableIterable<T> query(String key,
                         Object query)
        Get all the elements that are indexed by the provided key and specified query object. This is useful for graph implementations that support complex query capabilities. If querying is not supported, simply throw an UnsupportedOperationException.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the indexed elements
        query - the query object for the indexed elements' keys
        Returns:
        an iterable of elements that have a particular key/value in the index that match the query object

      • count

        long count(String key,
         Object value)
        Get a count of elements with a particular key/value pair. The semantics are the same as the get method.
        Parameters:
        key - denoting the sub-index to search
        value - the value to search for
        Returns:
        the collection of elements that meet that criteria

      • remove

        void remove(String key,
          Object value,
          T element)
        Remove an element indexed by a particular key/value.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the indexed element
        value - the value of the indexed element
        element - the element to remove given the key/value pair
